faqs.question: What kind of maintenance charges should I expect for a 3 BHK apartment here
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges in Sector 7 society complexes are typically calculated based on the area of the flat usually charged per square foot per month. For a 3 BHK flat these charges generally range between three rupees to five rupees per square foot depending on the level of amenities offered such as swimming pools gym maintenance and security services. These charges cover the upkeep of common areas elevators and utility services essential for smooth community living.

faqs.question: What are the common documentation requirements for purchasing a ready-to-move-in 3 BHK flat
faqs.answer: Required documents typically include a copy of the allotment letter from the builder sale agreement stamp duty receipt and proof of payment history. For the buyer identity proof address proof PAN card and Aadhar card are mandatory. If taking a loan bank sanction letters and disbursement proofs are also required. Ensure the flat has an Occupancy Certificate and Completion Certificate which verifies its legality and readiness for residence.

We work with legal experts to assist NRIs throughout the verification and buying process ensuring full compliance.
